title: Introduction
body:
Beyond a technical solution

Humanitarian assistance should be impartial, people-centred, transparent and accountable even when there are difficulties, challenges and obstacles. It is vital that you keep people safe from harm and do not inadvertently make the situation worse.

Effective assistance engages the affected population. It enables them to play a positive and practical role in their own recovery.

title: Introduction
body: Humanitarian assistance and protection should be delivered according to need, where governments are not able, or not willing, to fill the gap.Be aware of any deliberate or accidental acts of unfairness or discrimination, and take action to make sure the most at-risk receive the assistance they need. Acknowledge that you and your organisation cannot cover all the needs and that you should identify gaps and advocate for resources to fill them.
